page.title: 18THE WELSH LANGUAGE
page.content: Most grandparents of children at the school are Welsh speakers, but the parents of the children are not. The language is a popular subject among the children at the school however and may revive. The patterns of Welsh sentence survive in the English used by the people in the area especially in the order of the phrases:e.g. {It's only now I've sat down {Tell him it's this afternoon I'll come Where is it?{By the television it is. Sometimes the words reflect the Welsh {She's lost the bus} (lost = missed) {Mae hi wedi colli'r bws (Colli}=lost) {Mam =}grandmother (from{Mamgu}) Sometimes Welsh words intrude un-noticed in English sentences. e.g. I don't like to{poeni}people. {( Poeni}= worry)
